message_1: A math student needs to find the value of the inverse sine of 0.5. What is the angle in degrees that satisfies the equation sin(x) = 0.5?
message_2: The inverse sine of 0.5, also written as sin^(-1)(0.5) or arcsin(0.5), is the angle whose sine is 0.5. In this case, the angle is 30 degrees (or π/6 radians) since sin(30°) = 0.5.
